column4: I am trying to find out how to make it where i can use my full 160GB hard drive without wiping out my internal
so, any ideas of how i do it?
Me, i am trying to make ubuntu use the entire external hard drive, yet when i tried it once, it wiped me external and everything went blacnk...
it also wiped my internal as well
yes, the full hard drive, not a partition like wubi
well my internal has windows vista and full use now, and im trying to make my external just to be able to boot to an external device into ubuntu
not sure what you are trying to do exactly.
so you are trying to have the os on the external drive?
why not install the drive internal as a slave?
the problem you are having is the external usb is not yet loaded when grub looks for it.
how many drives in the desktop?
that's ok.  you can install the drive internally as a slave, so two drives in the case.   then the pc would see both drives and be able to boot from the slave drive from grub.
ok, try this.   when you boot go into the BIOS and see if the pc will boot from usb.  if it can then maybe you can make the external drive bootable.
if your pc is old then maybe not.  but you can remove your external drive from the case and install inside your pc as a slave, then install ubuntu on it.
ok, then you should be able to choose the external drive when you install ubuntu.  I am now wondering if the problem is vista.  I have heard that vista has issues with grub.
I am messaging you can you please respond...
